comment: Biochem is not a difficult class, but it is memorization-heavy. If you want to get an A in Dr. C's class, you will need to take pretty thorough notes from the textbook (which is free) and do all the optional practice work she provides. She assigns case studies which are easy and there are a few random pop quizzes. Work hard and you'll get an A.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Beware of pop quizzes--Accessible outside class

comment: She is such a sweet lady that really cares about her students, although I have really struggled in her class with it being only the exams, 15% on pop quizzes and case studies, and attendance. The exams can be very tough to study for with the powerpoint being pretty vague and during lecture she'll go off on other tangents so it can be hard get it al
rating_tags: Tough grader--Test heavy--Graded by few things

comment: Biochem is tough, but I had a great experience. Dr. C is a giver of points. Short answer and multiple choice on the tests, will adjust the number of points to help the class out. Posts study guides and practice quizzes. Attendance is required (5% of your grade, can miss 10 classes) and will give a few pop quizzes throughout. She is also very caring
rating_tags: Beware of pop quizzes--Caring--Accessible outside class

comment: I really enjoyed taking biochem with Dr. Chrestensen. Her lectures can be a little unclear and she tends to go off on tangents so set aside plenty of time to review and ask questions. We were graded on 3 exams, the final, and 3 case studies so there is little room for error. However, she offers partial credit and good feedback.
rating_tags: Lecture heavy--Test heavy--Graded by few things

comment: This class is just a hard class and Carol tries her best to teach it in the best way possible. I really liked her as a person, she is very sweet and caring. She is a decent professor but the exams are difficult. She makes it up by curving your final grade though. My advice: do not just study the powerpoints, study the textbook and outside material.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Beware of pop quizzes--Test heavy

comment: Dr.C is a very caring professor and wants you to do well. She's willing to meet up with you to help you better understand things. She's kind of all over the place, but she explains the material well. She welcomes all questions and encourages participation. The more questions that you try and answer in class even if it's wrong the better you'll do.

I think Chrestensen gets a bad rep & I actually ended up enjoying her class a lot. The exams make up most of your grade, but she'll sprinkle in pop quizzes for extra points as well. If you attend class, ask questions, & study, the tests aren't too bad. I would take her again, especially since she had such great energy & passion for biochem.

Attend ALL lectures/labs.RIGHT after class,write down EVERYTHING you did for experimental,concentrations,materials. Otherwise you will be lost.For lectures, when she ask a question, write it down to study for exams.Dr. C will not hand hold you, work together with the class as a team for success.Don't be afraid to say you don't understand.Its chaos.
Do not take her, she doesn't know how to teach by far the worst professor I ever had.
Extremely disorganized. Biochem is already hard enough but having a professor who seems incapable of following a flow in lecture makes it 10X more difficult. She goes off on tangents alot too

Chrestensen is definitely passionate about biochemistry but she is rusty after not teaching lecture for a couple of years. Her lectures, while informative, are not engaging. She does provide supplemental materials for topics. She is also hard to reach outside of class. Tried to review my tests a couple of times but she was busy with other students.
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--Clear grading criteria--Lecture heavy

comment: Do not take! She hasn't taught in a few years, so in lecture, she was all over the place. But then when it came time for the tests, it was so difficult. Test averages were in the low 70s. Be prepared to teach yourself. This was by far the worst class I've ever taken. Take anyone else for this class.

AVOID AT ALL COSTS!!! She hasn't taught biochem in a long time. Her lectures are all over the place and goes off topic often. This class was co-taught and didn't learn anything. Didn't curve any of the test even though the class avg were low 70s and the test were very hard. Avoid her for biochem if you need to learn the material for the MCAT or DAT
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--Test heavy--Group projects

comment: avoid at all costs. worst professor I've ever taken. extremely disorganized. flipped classroom. nothing you learn in the online videos or in class activities is reflective of the tests. the tests are extremely hard. AVOID!!!!!!!! worst class ever

The years of not teaching this course were evident in her lectures. She was very enthusiastic but was all over the place during lecture. Ended up having 2 other professors alongside her. We also used all of Cortes' tests and lecture format which were all rough. Biochem is difficult but having to teach yourself everything is salt on the wound.

Dr. Chrestensen hasn't taught biochem in a couple years, so she's a bit rusty, but she's super caring and accessible and really wants her students to succeed. Any shortcomings she may have while lecturing are supplemented by a series of videos instead of a textbook. That being said, she definitely knows her stuff.

Dr. Chrestensen is very sweet and very caring! She is lenient and wants to listen to the students, and it is refreshing. Please note she hasn't taught biochemistry in a very long time so she is rusty as of spring 2020. Also, consider that if you have yet to take the MCAT or DAT and you really need to know your stuff. Otherwise, she's fantastic!!

Dr. C is the best. She's absolutely hilarious and extremly intelligent. She is a fresh breath of air. Easily my favorite professor at KSU. She is very relatable and very approachable. She can be a bit unorganized and can go off subject but that's just her personality. Her tests and grading are hard but always fair. Take her.
Extremely disorganized. Confusing. You're better off teaching yourself from the book.

RUN! RUn!!! Do not take her class!!! i repeat DO NOT, it is better to wait for another semester than getting a grade that will not help your GPA. Again run! run! assume you're in a race with Usain Bolt your chance of wining the race is zero

I thought I would be the first person to provide the most updated information about this professor. I HIGHLY do not recommend her. It was hell having her as a professor.She had unrealistic expectations.Complained a lot, including personal. She is SUPER clustered. Exams were much harder. HINT: she has had to curve the overall class 5x in the past.

Dr. C is very knowledgeable in biochemistry, but teaches this class on a level that students can understand. Her grading was fair and she has a pleasant personality. The material however is DIFFICULT if you are not a Chem major.

TAKE HER FOR CHEM IF YOU WANT AN A!She curves the final grade if the average is below 75. Drops the lowest test grade of 4. Online quizzes every week will save your grade. 5 bonus pts on all test. Attendance not mandatory. She omits alot of material. test questions are the same as the practice questions at the end of each chp. TAKE HER!

I had her for lab and she would walk around constantly helping people. She would answer all of your questions but you had to figure it out and she would guide you to the correct answer to help you learn. She was wonderful! I am so excited to be in her lecture class this coming semester.She grades hard but if you do it right then there are no proble

I had her for lab. She was very hepful. She walked around and helped you with lab report questions, she was always in a good mood. She is having a baby in May '08, so I don't know when she will be back. But, for a lab I thought she was great. I can't speak about her other ratings for higher Chem lecture classes. I thought she was clear and helpful
Most comfusing professor. DO NOT GET FOOLED BY THE SMILE SHE WILL FAIL YOU.
No Comments
